title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: On hearing this remark, OliverSirrel laughed uproariously and bounded downstairs,to join his friends in " The Grove." The Grove wasa snug apartment below the ground-level, lightedonly by a crusie,1 in the daytime and nightalike.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: The keeper could give him no informationabout the gentlemen referred to, but he was pleasedto acquaint him of the presence of other two gentlemen who were waiting his arrival—they were theProfessor and Juris. On hearing this remark, OliverSirrel laughed uproariously and bounded downstairs,to join his friends in " The Grove." The Grove wasa snug apartment below the ground-level, lightedonly by a crusie,1 in the daytime and nightalike.

title: My first visit to Europe:
author: Dickinson, Andrew
snippet: In the Ball-Roora Grove the court held its whirligig dances on the grass. The Grove of Apollo is filled with many statues  of exquisite work, like all the rest. There is the Grove of Domes ; the Star Grove, with a fine marble statue at every radius ; the Green Round Grove ; and the Colonnade Grove, a grand rotunda of thirty-two marble pillars, with a Corinthian  cornice uniting the whole, and a white marble vase at the top of each column.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: The atmosphere of the Mermaid was close andstuffy, so much so, indeed, that Juris declared hisfriend Vergil had uttered more strange oaths withinhalf an hour that night, than he had heard for awhole twelvemonth. The Grove simply reeked withthe smell of whisky and stale tobacco. It was withconsiderable difficulty, therefore, that Vergil, whohad been suffering from a bronchial affection for sometime, was able to breathe in its midst.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: By thetime the Mermaid was reached, there were only leftVergil, Juris, and the Professor, besides two or threemore of their closer companions. The next minutethey also had left a vacant space in the street, and,finding comfortable quarters in " The Grove " below,began to regale themselves with tankards of ale andBetty Simpson's hard " bawbee bakes."
